intro: Knautia dalmatica f. clementii, commonly known as the Dalmatian knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered blooms of pink to red petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in gardens.
